title: COVID-19 Vaccines
author: Northwestern Medicine
description: Learn more about the COVID-19 vaccine and the vaccination plan for Northwestern Medicine patients.
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccination The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) [recommends](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/safety-of-vaccines.html) COVID-19 vaccines for everyone age 6 months and older. Northwestern Medicine follows CDC guidelines for giving the COVID-19 vaccine. The current COVID-19 vaccine is called the "bivalent" vaccine. The number of doses and time between doses varies by age and medical history. See the current CDC [guidelines](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/clinical-considerations/interim-considerations-us.html#:~:text=COVID%2D19%20vaccination%20is%20recommended,date%20with%20COVID%2D19%20vaccination.#:~:text=COVID%2D19%20vaccination%20is%20recommended,date%20with%20COVID%2D19%20vaccination.##:~:text=COVID%2D19%20vaccination%20is%20recommended,date%20with%20COVID%2D19%20vaccination.#:~:text=COVID%2D19%20vaccination%20is%20recommended,date%20with%20COVID%2D19%20vaccination.) on COVID-19 vaccination to learn more about how these guidelines impact you and your family. If you have questions about the COVID-19 vaccine, please talk to your primary care physician. Northwestern Medicine offers the Pfizer-BioNTech bivalent vaccine. You have several options for getting this vaccine at Northwestern Medicine. Find a Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine Location: Northwestern Medicine Immediate Care Centers - You do not need an appointment. - You do not need to be a current Northwestern Medicine patient. - Please bring your COVID-19 vaccination record with you. - View the following lists to see which Immediate Care Centers offer vaccines for patients of different ages. Due to vaccine availability, some Immediate Care Center locations may not be able to offer COVID-19 vaccinations. - 6 months to 11 years - 12 and Older [Huntley](/locations/immediate-care-huntley) Saturdays 10 am to 2 pm [Lake Bluff](https://www.nm.org/locations/immediate-care-lake-bluff) Wednesdays 10 am to 2 pm [St. Charles](/locations/immediate-care-saint-charles) Wednesdays 10 am to 2 pm [Sycamore](/locations/immediate-care-sycamore) Fridays 10 am to 2 pm [Wheaton](/locations/immediate-care-wheaton) Saturdays 10 am to 2 pm Please note: Beginning May 2, these locations will offer a second dose of the bivalent Pfizer-BioN-Tech vaccine to [people who qualify](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/clinical-considerations/covid-19-vaccines-us.html). We offer COVID-19 vaccination Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11am to 2 pm, at the following locations: Northwestern Medicine Primary Care Sites Northwestern Medicine patients may be able to get a COVID-19 vaccine at a Primary Care office. - You must be a patient at Northwestern Medicine. You do not have to be a patient at the site where you get the vaccine. - Days and times are limited. - You need to make an appointment. Select the location for contact details.
